column1: Unspecified delay cancels Norwegian Encore sailing
column3: Passengers will get full refunds or full return of a future cruise credit (FCC), plus an FCC valued at 50% of the voyage fare.

column1: Brand USA chief Chris Thompson on jump-starting travel to the U.S.
column3: Following the reopening of U.S. borders, Thompson discusses which markets are showing the most interest in returning.

column1: Carnival, Virgin, American Queen grab a cuppa at CruiseWorld
column3: A Coffee Chats session focused on just how much the cruise lines need and appreciate their travel advisor partners.

column1: Banyan Tree expands to Mexico's Valle de Guadalupe
column3: The Banyan Tree Valle de Guadalupe Resort, Spa and Winery in Baja Peninsula will feature the hotel group's first proprietary winery.

column1: New touches on Oasis of the Seas make for happy returns
column3: The new Oasis of the Seas recently wrapped up its first series of cruises since the pandemic shutdown and travel advisors onboard welcomed its return to the New York market.

column1: Grupo Vidanta launches a cruise line
column3: Vidanta Cruises expects to launch its inaugural ship, the Vidanta Elegant, next year.

column1: MGM doesn't see a future for the Mirage, but experts say others might
column3: Analysts offered a range of prospective buyers, both established Las Vegas players and regional casino operators seeking to enter the market.

column1: Writing the first sentences of my next chapter
column3: We were ready to do what's right for us and for our agency. And life is good.

column1: Sandals' Stewart on 'doubling down' on expansion
column3: Tourism doesn't operate without the entire ecosystem, so when cruise is not there and tours are not taking place ... something is just missing, Stewart said during a speech at CruiseWorld.

column1: New eats and attractions at Resorts World Las Vegas
column3: New restaurants, a nightclub and a cigar bar have joined the mix since the megaresort opened on the Strip this summer, and a concert venue will begin hosting shows in the coming weeks.

column1: Smaller, older Carnival Pride still has it where it counts
column3: The quintessential Carnival experience includes plentiful eats, live music everywhere and a fun-loving vibe. From that standpoint, the Carnival Pride isn't missing a thing.

column1: Norwegian's Del Rio: Mandate is working -- and I have the numbers to prove it
column3: Speaking at CruiseWorld, CEO Frank Del Rio credited the vaccine mandate for higher booking levels and much higher prices at all three of the company's cruise lines for late 2022 and all of 2023 compared with pre-pandemic numbers.

column1: Creation of federal travel post signals new respect for industry
column3: A chief travel and tourism officer position to be created within the DOT as part of the massive infrastructure bill has travel industry advocates feeling bullish.

column1: Azamara will offer a world cruise
column3: Details will be coming later this week, the cruise line said.

column1: Family travel worth the challenge
column3: Education and specialization are key for agents who want to book family travel, according to Sally Black, founder of travel agency Vacationkids and the director of the Family Travel Association (FTA).

column1: Frontier orders 91 more A321neo planes
column3: CEO Barry Biffle says the order will enable the discount carrier to triple in size by 2029.

column1: Norwegian Cruise Line: Advisors and no discounting are keys to sales success
column3: The Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings CEO tells advisors at CruiseWorld that they can make more money selling NCL.

column1: UN group issues guidelines for sustainable aviation fuel
column3: The move, announced at the COP26 climate change conference, addresses concerns about the impact of SAF production on ecosystems.

column1: Carnival, Norwegian restart service from two Fla. ports
column3: The Carnival Pride resumed sailing from Tampa and the Norwegian Escape from Port Canaveral.

column1: Frontier Airlines pulling plug on Newark operations
column3: The discount carrier is scheduled to make its final Newark departure on Feb. 16.

column1: Jamaica aims for a near-record tourism year in 2022
column3: Donovan White, the island's director of tourism, forecast that by the end of 2022, Jamaica's visitor numbers will total 4.1 million.

column1: No seats? No problem at the National Finals Rodeo
column3: The event, which sells out every year, is offering a pass that gives non-ticketholders access to all other venues in and around the Thomas & Mack Center, including a large screen to watch the rodeo.

column1: Margaritaville Beach House Key West opens
column3: The oceanfront resort on Smathers Beach is a rebranding and renovation of the Barbary Beach House.

column1: Reports: Trump selling operating rights to D.C. hotel
column3: CGI Merchant Group agreed to pay the Trump Organization $375 million for the rights to the 263-room hotel and has plans to rebrand it as a Waldorf Astoria.

column1: CWT exits Chapter 11 bankruptcy one day after filing
column3: The court's approval appears to set CWT on a course to complete the financial recapitalization process it announced in September.

column1: Travel tech takes the stage at Phocuswright
column3: Startups presenting at the Phocuswright Innovation Summit offer solutions for hotels, advisors and travelers.

column1: Carnival and NCL restart service from two Florida ports
column3: The Carnival Pride resumed sailing from Tampa and the Norwegian Escape from Port Canaveral.

column1: Aruba hotelier signs on at UN climate change meeting
column3: Ewald Biemans of Bucuti & Tara Beach Resort in Aruba was one of the global hospitality leaders to sign the Glasgow Declaration on Climate Action in Tourism.

column1: First Call: Rotterdam blends new touches, nods to past
column3: A first look at Holland America Line's newest ship, the Rotterdam, the seventh vessel to go by that name.

column1: 'America's Got Talent' brings its best to Luxor
column3: Winners and other fan favorites from the smash TV show will perform Wednesdays through Sundays.

column1: Vegas welcomes back the world with true Sin City flair
column3: Showgirls in full costume were at the gate as the first flight from London arrived. It was a 'watershed moment' for the city, tourism officials said.

column1: Is demand strong for the Caribbean? These tourism experts say yes
column3: We had a great summer with big increases in ADR and RevPar due to rate increases, said Peter Hopgood of Paulson Puerto Rico Hotels. Data shows demand is there.

column1: Cayman Islands ready to welcome visitors despite CDC alert
column3: The Cayman Islands is now on the CDC's list of Level 4 countries, but the Ministry of Tourism pointed out that it is one of 80 countries, including 15 in the Caribbean, that is on the list.

column1: American Airlines pares down New York service
column3: Several of the eliminated routes will be served by Northeast Alliance partner JetBlue.

column1: Azamara will bring immersive experiences to world cruise
column3: A 155-night sailing on the Azamara Onward will do 22 overnight stays and 27 late nights in ports.

column1: ASTA fortifies advocacy efforts with new hire
column3: Jessica Klement will be responsible for major portions of the Society's work to advocate for the travel agency community at all levels.

column1: Tom Williams is retiring as Universal Parks chairman
column3: Mark Woodbury will be promoted to the role of chairman and CEO.

column1: White House stands firm on Trump's aircraft-emission standards
column3: Also, the Biden administration is defending those standards against a court challenge filed by environmental groups.

column1: Windstar introduces inclusive fare
column3: The price includes WiFi, all gratuities and unlimited wine, beer and cocktails. A la carte pricing is still offered.

column1: Air Tahiti Nui is resuming Los Angeles-Paris flights
column3: The carrier will operate a four-times-weekly flight between LAX and Paris de Gaulle on a Boeing 787-900 Dreamliner.

column1: Shaquille O'Neal's mom named godmother of Carnival Radiance
column3: Lucille O'Neal is an author, speaker and philanthropist in addition to being mother of Carnival Cruise Line brand ambassador Shaquille O'Neal.

column1: Kaufer: Leaving Tripadvisor, but not necessarily travel
column3: Steve Kaufer told attendees at the Phocuswright Conference that although he is leaving Tripadvisor, he is not retiring, nor ruling out a second act in the travel industry.

column1: Travel advisors applaud the great cruise giveaway
column3: Cruise lines are providing lots of opportunities for travel advisors to sail and to tell the stories and post the photos that sell cruises.

column1: Celebrity Cruises boss talks Fain's departure, Apex, cruising's return
column3: Lisa Lutoff-Perlo took the stage before the Apex's inaugural revenue cruise -- 581 days after the ship was originally scheduled to depart.

column1: Royal Caribbean's CEO on why big ships are not just about size
column3: For three decades, Richard Fain has introduced several of the world's biggest cruise ships. But it wasn't just to be able to fit the most passengers onboard.

column1: Recent Cancun gun violence is the exception not the rule
column3: Once again Mexico is making headlines because of gun-related gang violence. But experts assert that Cancun remains safe for tourists.

column1: Travel advisors urged to prepare for the luxury floodgates to open
column3: The luxury segment has changed, and travel advisors need to keep up with the demands of their top clients, according to two luxury-travel experts.

column1: Where everybody knows your name
column3: Grand Residences Riviera Cancun has a remarkably loyal following, and it’s easy to see why: The guest experience is flawless.

column1: Disney Cruise Line will require Covid-19 vaccination for kids ages 5 and older
column3: The new policy is effective for all sailings departing on or after Jan. 13.

column1: World Travel Holdings will recruit ICs for franchise agencies
column3: Host agency Cruises Inc. is being phased out, but WTH will retain its methods of recruiting ICs. Now, Dream Vacations and CruiseOne franchises will be the beneficiaries.

column1: Regent Seven Seas returns to U.S. cruising
column3: The luxury line launched its first cruise from the U.S. since March 2020, when the Seven Seas Explorer departed Miami on Nov. 15.

column1: Kayak adds two hotels in Playa del Carmen
column3: The Kayak Sol and Kayak Luna are conversions of two boutique properties in the Caribbean beach town.

column1: Ritz-Carlton Yacht Collection hires Kristian Anderson to head sales
column3: Anderson, a cruise sales veteran with more than 30 years of experience, most recently was executive vice president of global sales for Uniworld Boutique River Cruises.

column1: Seamless travel? Can't happen. Here's why
column3: At Phocuswright, brilliant ideas were on full display. But why can't we innovate our way to a trip with no speed bumps or complicating factors?

column1: At Phocuswright, laying out long-term threats to the industry
column3: A panel warns that climate change and staffing shortages could continue to cripple the travel industry regardless of progress made against the pandemic.

column1: United will resume its U.S.-Singapore service in January
column3: It will be the first time United has flown the route since March 2020, when the pandemic began.

column1: Launch of the Nebu marks another new luxury river ship on the Nile
column3: Central Holidays' newest ship, the Nebu, entered service on the Nile River last month.

column1: Vail Resorts will forecast wait times for ski lifts in app
column3: The tool, which will be available in Vail's EpicMix app, will enable skiers to plot their time on the mountain at 12 resorts.

column1: Two CWT executives earn promotions
column3: Nick Vournakis and Derek Sharp will both take on executive vice president roles at the Travel Weekly Power List agency on Dec. 1.

column1: Luxury wellness resort Hacienda AltaGracia opens in Costa Rica
column3: The all-inclusive resort is in the Auberge Resorts Collection.

column1: Holiday Inn Express hits 3,000-hotel milestone
column3: Another 650 Holiday Inn Express hotels are expected to open in the coming years, with the brand accounting for more than a third of IHG's global pipeline.

column1: MSC Cruises floats out the Seascape
column3: The fourth ship in MSC's Seaside class, the Seascape is slated for delivery in November 2022.

column1: Jim Berra is leaving Royal Caribbean
column3: The cruise line's chief marketing officer since 2015, Berra introduced the well-known Come Seek campaign.

column1: Vietnam Airlines launching twice-weekly flights to the U.S.
column3: The flights connecting San Francisco with Ho Chi Minh City will be the first regularly scheduled service between the U.S. and Vietnam.

column1: Celebrity Cruises' fourth Edge ship to be called Ascent
column3: The Celebrity Ascent is scheduled to debut in early 2023.

column1: Marriott to deploy Amadeus res system
column3: Marriott's aim is to make its reservations platform more robust with merchandising capabilities.

column1: Mexico deploying National Guard troops to Riviera Maya
column3: Defense Secretary Luis Cresencio Sandoval said that 1,445 guard members will be sent to the Caribbean coast to reinforce the region's security in the wake of shootings in Puerto Morelos and Tulum.

column1: Partners providing free Covid test kits to premium biz travelers
column3: American Airlines and British Airways have partnered with American Express Global Business Travel and global Covid-19 testing provider Qured.

column1: Where can Americans travel in Europe? A country-by-country guide
column3: Travel Weekly is tracking the Covid-related travel requirements for countries in Europe. Updated Nov. 18.

column1: River cruise lines give tips on selling groups
column3: It stands to reason that if booking individuals on river cruises is a lucrative endeavor, then booking groups is an especially gainful proposition.

column1: Riviera River Cruises releases its 2022 holiday sailing schedule
column3: Riviera River Cruises is looking ahead to the 2022 holidays with 20 festive departures across six seasonal itineraries.
